intro: Campanula glomerata f. speciosa, commonly known as the showy bellflower, is a cultivar of the campanula genus native to Europe. It is characterized by its dense clusters of large, showy blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to attract pollinators.
